Dr. Michael J. Curley Optical actuators, optical switching and nonlinear optics Office: 028 V. M. Chambers Bld. Phone:    (256) 372-8236  E-Mail: michael.curley@aamu.edu Home Page: http://www.physics.aamu.edu/~curley/ Recent Publications Sergey S. Sarkisov, Michael J. Curley, LaQuieta Huey, Aisha B. Fields, Sergey S. Sarkisov

                     R. B. Lal, "Investigation on the growth kinetics of KDP:LAP and TGS:LAP single crystals",

                     Abdeldayem, Curtis Banks, Tesfaye Gebre, Manmohan D. Aggarwal, Jai Ching Wang, Matthew
                     E. Edwards, " Pockels coefficients characterization of pure and iron doped lithium
                     niobate using adaptive optics and the Czochralski crystal growth technique", Proc.
                     SPIE Vol. 5876, p. 270-280, Laser Beam Shaping VI; Fred M. Dickey, David L. Shealy;
                     Eds., Aug 2005 Sergey S. Sarkisov, Michael J. Curley, Burl H. Peterson, George Edlin, Ronald Snow,
                     John V. York, John F. Rushing, "Cloud-cover mitigation of the influence of atmospheric
                     turbulence on propagation of laser beams", Proc. SPIE Vol. 5712, p. 151-161, Free-Space
                     Laser Communication Technologies XVII; G. Stephen Mecherle; Ed., Apr 2005 S. Sarkisov, B.H. Peterson, M. Curley, V.N. Nesterov, T. Timofeva, M. Antipin, E.I.

                     "Optical spectroscopy and nonlinear transmittance study of fullerene C60 in mixtures

                     and materials, Vol. 13, 1, March 2004
